title: How to Make Sausage, Peppers, and Onion Sandwiches

steps.headline: Brown the sausage links in a frying pan on medium high heat.
While the sausage is frying, cut and clean three peppers (1 red, 1 orange, 1 yellow) into Julienne style (long strips).
steps.description: Peel onion, cut the onion into fours and then separate the onion.

steps.headline: Take the sausage out of the frying pan and put them on a cutting board into bit size pieces.
Add about 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of balsamic vinegar to the frying pan that the sausage just came out of.
Stir the balsamic vinegar around the pan to loosen up anything that is on the inside of the pan.
Add a 28 oz can of Tuttarossa tomato sauce.
Put a dime size of dried oregano in palm and rub together over the pan.
Add sausage, peppers, and onions and mix together.
Let it slowly boil for about 15 minutes.
Turn it down on low and occasionally stir for about 45 minutes.
Take the rolls and cut them open.
Fill with sausage, peppers, and onions and ENJOY!

text: Brown the sausage links in a frying pan on medium high heat. (Do not fully cook the sausage) While the sausage is frying, cut and clean three peppers (1 red, 1 orange, 1 yellow) into Julienne style (long strips). Peel onion, cut the onion into fours and then separate the onion. Take the sausage out of the frying pan and put them on a cutting board into bit size pieces.  Add about 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of balsamic vinegar to the frying pan that the sausage just came out of.  Stir the balsamic vinegar around the pan to loosen up anything that is on the inside of the pan.  Add a 28 oz can of Tuttarossa tomato sauce.  Sprinkle in some black pepper.  Put a dime size of dried oregano in palm and rub together over the pan.  Stir the sauce together.  Add sausage, peppers, and onions and mix together.  Let it slowly boil for about 15 minutes.  Turn it down on low and occasionally stir for about 45 minutes.  Take the rolls and cut them open.  Fill with sausage, peppers, and onions and ENJOY! ! Finished.
